summary: The Banning Unlawful Machinegun Parts Act (BUMP Act) amends Title 18 of the United States Code to prohibit the import, sale, manufacture, transfer, or possession of devices that increase the rate of fire of semiautomatic firearms, effectively outlawing certain modifications. It defines “semiautomatic firearm” and outlines registration requirements for existing firearms modified before the act's enactment. The bill also amends the National Firearms Act by including modified semiautomatic firearms in its definition.
